subject: PE Today: Hugging Dr. Death
body:
CBSNews.com













Hugging 
      Doctor DeathThe image of the “60 Minutes” correspondent and 
      “Dr. Death” embracing upon Kevorkian’s release from prison Friday was 
      beamed up on the web within minutes of its occurrence and spread like 
      wildfire, immediately raising questions about credibility and objectivity 
      – including inside this writer’s head. [+ Read More]



Scared 
      Yet?Much of the coverage of the alleged plot to bomb the 
      fuel pipeline supplying John F. Kennedy airport has stressed the "chilling 
      and terrifying," "scary," and "very very frightening" nature of the 
      plot. The media, it seems, have gone into classic 
      scaremongering mode, and Public Eye is here for your daily dose of sanity. 
      [+ Read More]



Talk 
      ShowIf  you're 
      going to invite someone to a 
      debate, you've got to play fair. And that means letting each candidate have 
      their say. A debate, after all, is one of the few 
      opportunities for a candidate looking for a breakthrough moment to cut 
      through the media bias against second tier candidates. If someone doesn't 
      have a real chance, they shouldn't be there; if they do, they have as much 
      right to talk as anyone. [+ Read More]
